title: Just for laughs
body:
So Lucian on my team, as soon as the game starts, says:

"I can't tell you how glad I am that my Lucian is meta."

Goes 4/13/3
Mid goes 3/11/4
Jungle goes 2/5/1

Goodness gracious me.

replies.body:
At least it's not as frustrating as giving up your role to someone who insists they are a 'main' and that they'll feed (unintentionally) anywhere else, then winning despite being in your off role but having them feeding their butt off anyway.

On a rational level I understand that they asked because they had a much better chance in that role, and that you can't win every lane or every game. But on an emotional level it's rather irritating.

I suppose that's always the danger with one tricks. Little to no adaptability/flexibility.
Just because a particular champion is meta doesn't mean that they're going to win you a game.
I'm very aware. I'm also very capable of carrying a game, as long as my team aren't literally 300-gold minions.
